result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L May was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Costs of the action have been paid in full, with the exception of Court-appointed attorney fees. Defendant is to pay $75 per pay period toward attorney fees starting in May.
Restitution has been paid in full.

Defendant Amanda L May in court with attorney Jacob M. Blazkovec. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions receipt of tax refund. Defense advises of Court-appointment. State advises of provisional sentencing. Discussion regarding amounts due. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Court imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Amanda L May in court with attorney Jacob M. Blazkovec. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Originally set for sentencing. Defense advises that Defendant hasn't received tax refund yet. Court questions Defendant, who accepts refund within a couple of weeks.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Amanda L May in court with attorney Jacob M. Blazkovec. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 2. Count 1 is dismissed but read in for sentencing and/or restitution. State advises that Defense will be requesting that sentencing be put off to allow Defendant to pay financial obligations. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Amanda L May appeared by phone. Attorney Jacob M. Blazkovec appeared in Court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is at work at WS Packaging in Algoma. Defense advises of offer with financial incentives, requests plea date with delayed sentencing to allow Defendant time to come up with money.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Not to write any checks. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Amanda L May in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant has Jake Blazkovec as Court-appointed attorney in Kewaunee, was appointed 2 months ago. Court questions Defendant regarding appointment. Court orders Defendant to continue payment of $75 per paycheck here when case ends in Kewaunee, appoints Jake Blazkovec. Defense can enter written not guilty plea to avoid next appearance.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
